subject: Real Estate
title: Mesopotamia's First Land Records
description: One-minute skill: Mesopotamia's First Land Records.

hook.text: Around 3100 BCE, Sumerian scribes pressed wedge marks into wet clay to record who owned which field.

buildup.text: These cuneiform tablets listed boundaries, owners, and the price paid in silver or barley.

discovery.text: Land could be bought, sold, and inherited â€” property rights existed before coined money did.

twist.text: Disputes were common. One tablet records a man suing his own brother over a date-palm grove.

climax.text: Judges ruled using written deeds, making these clay tablets the world's first title documents.

punchline.text: Real estate paperwork is 5,000 years old.

quiz.question: What did Sumerian cuneiform tablets record about land?
